title: Retheme app to classic blue, turquoise, and gold using existing OKLCH tokens

requirements.summary: Update OKLCH CSS variables for primary/secondary/accent (and foreground counterparts) to a classic blue/turquoise/gold palette in light and dark modes so Tailwind + shadcn theme utilities inherit automatically.
acceptanceCriteria: In both frontend/index.css and frontend/src/index.css, the CSS variables for --primary/--secondary/--accent (and their -foreground counterparts) are updated to reflect a classic blue, turquoise, and gold palette.
Light mode and dark mode remain readable (sufficient contrast between background/foreground and for buttons/links).
No Tailwind config changes are required beyond continuing to map colors to CSS variables as currently implemented.

file_operations.description: Update :root and .dark theme tokens for --primary/--secondary/--accent and their -foreground counterparts to classic blue (primary), turquoise (secondary), and gold (accent) using the existing OKLCH CSS variable system so Tailwind/shadcn-ui color utilities inherit automatically. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Mirror the same OKLCH token updates for --primary/--secondary/--accent and their -foreground counterparts in both :root and .dark to keep the theme consistent regardless of which global stylesheet is referenced by the app. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Replace hardcoded mint/emerald/green/gray/white Tailwind utilities in app sections/navigation with theme token-based classes to ensure consistent theming and readable gradients.
acceptanceCriteria: Components that currently use hardcoded emerald/green styling (e.g., AdminPanelSection headings/buttons) are updated to use theme tokens instead of fixed Tailwind colors like text-emerald-700 or bg-emerald-600.
Nav bar, hero, forms, cards, and admin overlay all visually reflect the updated theme without leftover mint/emerald-specific colors.
The page background gradient continues to work with the new palette and does not clash with text readability.

file_operations.description: Replace hardcoded emerald/white/gray Tailwind classes with theme token-based classes (e.g., text-primary, bg-card, bg-primary, text-primary-foreground, bg-muted, border-border) while continuing to compose styling via consuming component className props (do not edit shadcn-ui files under frontend/src/components/ui). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Replace hardcoded overlay backdrop colors (e.g., bg-black/bg-opacity-50) with theme token-based classes (e.g., foreground/background-based alpha utilities) so the admin overlay visually aligns with the updated palette while keeping content readable. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Audit and, if needed, adjust the page-level background gradient class usage to ensure it remains token-based and readable with the new blue/turquoise/gold palette (keep the same section structure and no new features). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
